page.title: International reactions to the 2011 Egyptian revolution

rev.diff:
Line 166: Line 166:
Protests were held at the Egyptian embassy in [[Tunis]] in solidarity and in hope that the two countries' "revolutions" would spark a chain of events around the Arab world. Tunisia's [[Progressive Democratic Party]] said that Egypt had "called in the hour of change for an end to injustice and dictatorship. The Egyptian people supported the Tunisian people's revolution. Our heart is with you and our voices never cease to pray for victory." There was a demonstration outside the Egyptian embassy in [[Doha]], [[Qatar]].<ref name="protests"/> There were protests in Lebanon warning of the spread of the protests.<ref>{{cite web|author= Piven, Ben |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/01/201112920129971160.html |title=The Domino Effect: Pan-Arab Unrest â Interactive of Anti-Government Protests from Tunisia to Egypt, Yemen and Jordan, with Pro-Western Regimes under Threat|work=[[Al Jazeera English]] |date=29 January 2011 |accessdate=30 January 2011}}</ref> On 25 January a march held in [[Gaza]] in solidarity with the protests was suppressed by Hamas. Police officers dressed in civilian clothing arrested six women and detained some 20 others, according to [[Human Rights Watch]].<ref>Issacharoff, Avi (2 February 2011). [http://www.haaretz.com/news/international/hamas-worried-upheaval-in-arab-world-will-spill-into-gaza-1.340690 "Hamas Worried Upheaval in Arab World Will Spill into Gaza â Gaza Police Disperse Rally Showing Solidarity with Egyptian Protesters; Several Thousand Join Facebook Group Calling for a Protest Against Hamas Rule in the Strip"]. ''[[Haaretz]]''. Retrieved 2 February 2011.</ref>
Protests were held at the Egyptian embassy in [[Tunis]] in solidarity and in hope that the two countries' "revolutions" would spark a chain of events around the Arab world. Tunisia's [[Progressive Democratic Party]] said that Egypt had "called in the hour of change for an end to injustice and dictatorship. The Egyptian people supported the Tunisian people's revolution. Our heart is with you and our voices never cease to pray for victory." There was a demonstration outside the Egyptian embassy in [[Doha]], [[Qatar]].<ref name="protests"/> There were protests in Lebanon warning of the spread of the protests.<ref>{{cite web|author= Piven, Ben |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/01/201112920129971160.html |title=The Domino Effect: Pan-Arab Unrest â Interactive of Anti-Government Protests from Tunisia to Egypt, Yemen and Jordan, with Pro-Western Regimes under Threat|work=[[Al Jazeera English]] |date=29 January 2011 |accessdate=30 January 2011}}</ref> On 25 January a march held in [[Gaza]] in solidarity with the protests was suppressed by Hamas. Police officers dressed in civilian clothing arrested six women and detained some 20 others, according to [[Human Rights Watch]].<ref>Issacharoff, Avi (2 February 2011). [http://www.haaretz.com/news/international/hamas-worried-upheaval-in-arab-world-will-spill-into-gaza-1.340690 "Hamas Worried Upheaval in Arab World Will Spill into Gaza â Gaza Police Disperse Rally Showing Solidarity with Egyptian Protesters; Several Thousand Join Facebook Group Calling for a Protest Against Hamas Rule in the Strip"]. ''[[Haaretz]]''. Retrieved 2 February 2011.</ref>
â
In Syria a peaceful demonstration was held on 29 January in front of the Egyptian embassy in Damascus to protest against the killing of protesters by Egyptian police. Syrian security forces were deployed around the embassy and blocked demonstrators from reaching it.<ref>{{dead link|date=January 2011|reason=link provided is to dynamic page (in arabic with english portal link offered). will requires some research to fish intended article.}} {{cite web |url=http://www.metransparent.com/spip.php?page=article&id_article=12661&lang=ar |title=Syrian Security Forces Block Demonstrators from Reaching the Egyptian Embassy|date=30 January 2011|work=[[Middle East Transparent]]}}</ref> [[Arab Israeli]]s held rallies in solidarity with the Egyptian protesters.<ref>{{cite news|author=Raved, Ahiya|date=29 January 2011|title=Arab Israelis Back Egyptian Protestors â Protests Held Across Nation; Former MK Makhoul: We're Showing Solidarity with Arab Nations|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4020862,00.html|work=[[Ynetnews]]|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref>
+
In Syria a peaceful demonstration was held on 29 January in front of the Egyptian embassy in Damascus to protest against the killing of protesters by Egyptian police. Syrian security forces were deployed around the embassy and blocked demonstrators from reaching it.<ref>{{dead link|date=January 2011|reason=link provided is to dynamic page (in arabic with english portal link offered). will requires some research to fish intended article.}} {{cite web |url=http://www.metransparent.com/spip.php?page=article&id_article=12661&lang=ar |title=Ø§ÙÙÙØªØ­Ø± Ø§ÙØ³ÙØ±Ù ÙÙ "Ø­Ø³Ù Ø¹ÙÙ Ø¹ÙÙØ©": Ø¯ÙØ´Ù Ø­Ø¸Ø±Øª ÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø© ÙØ¯Ø¹Ù ÙØµØ± " |translation=Syrian Security Forces Block Demonstrators from Reaching the Egyptian Embassy|date=30 January 2011|work=[[Middle East Transparent]]}}</ref> [[Arab Israeli]]s held rallies in solidarity with the Egyptian protesters.<ref>{{cite news|author=Raved, Ahiya|date=29 January 2011|title=Arab Israelis Back Egyptian Protestors â Protests Held Across Nation; Former MK Makhoul: We're Showing Solidarity with Arab Nations|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4020862,00.html|work=[[Ynetnews]]|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref>
â
On 28 January between 200 and 400 protesters held demonstrations outside the [[Fatih Mosque]] (where political activism has become more common since the [[Gaza flotilla raid]]) after the Friday prayer in Istanbul. A small leftist group gathered outside the Egyptian embassy in [[Ankara]], Turkey.<ref name="protests"/><ref>{{Dead link|date=January 2011}} {{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://www.apimages.com/OneUp.aspx?st=det&ids=Turkey%20Egypt&showact=details&sort=date&prds=10135&intv=3d&sh=101&kwstyle=or&adte=1296393346&pagez=60&cfasstyle=AND&rids=7953b8aaa25a48829bddc873c33390a9&dbm=PThirtyDay&page=1&xslt=1 |title=Turkey Egypt |agency=Associated Press |date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Iranian students gathered in front of the Egypt's Interest Section{{clarify|date=February 2011|reason=which embassy?}} in [[Tehran]] on 30 January to support the uprisings in Egypt. According to IRNA,{{who|date=February 2011|reason=what is this? no easily found wiki article}} the students, shouting slogans such as "Down with US, Down with Israel, Down with UK and down with Hosni Mubarak," condemned the Egyptian government's measures to confront protesters. The students demanded that the Iranian government shut down Egypt's Interest Section in Iran.<ref>[[Staff writer]] (30 January 2011). [http://english.irib.ir/news/political/item/70539-iranian-students-condemn-egyptian-police-measures-against-protesters "Iranian Students Condemn Egyptian Police Measures Against Protesters"]. ''[[Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting]]''. Retrieved 31 January 2011.</ref>
+
On 28 January between 200 and 400 protesters held demonstrations outside the [[Fatih Mosque]] (where political activism has become more common since the [[Gaza flotilla raid]]) after the Friday prayer in Istanbul. A small leftist group gathered outside the Egyptian embassy in [[Ankara]], Turkey.<ref name="protests"/><ref>{{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://www.apimages.com/OneUp.aspx?st=det&ids=Turkey%20Egypt&showact=details&sort=date&prds=10135&intv=3d&sh=101&kwstyle=or&adte=1296393346&pagez=60&cfasstyle=AND&rids=7953b8aaa25a48829bddc873c33390a9&dbm=PThirtyDay&page=1&xslt=1 |title=Turkey Egypt |agency=Associated Press |date=28 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Iranian students gathered in front of the Egypt's Interest Section{{clarify|date=February 2011|reason=which embassy?}} in [[Tehran]] on 30 January to support the uprisings in Egypt. According to IRNA,{{who|date=February 2011|reason=what is this? no easily found wiki article}} the students, shouting slogans such as "Down with US, Down with Israel, Down with UK and down with Hosni Mubarak," condemned the Egyptian government's measures to confront protesters. The students demanded that the Iranian government shut down Egypt's Interest Section in Iran.<ref>[[Staff writer]] (30 January 2011). [http://english.irib.ir/news/political/item/70539-iranian-students-condemn-egyptian-police-measures-against-protesters "Iranian Students Condemn Egyptian Police Measures Against Protesters"]. ''[[Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting]]''. Retrieved 31 January 2011.</ref>
On 28 January [[Egyptian Canadian|Egyptians living in Canada]] and others gathered at the embassy in Ottawa as well as the consulate in [[MontrÃ©al]]. The next day, Canadians in [[Toronto]], [[MontrÃ©al]], [[Vancouver]], and other cities peacefully demonstrated in support of the uprising, criticising the Canadian government's cautious and generic response.<ref>{{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|title=Demonstrators Across Canada Rally in Support of Egyptian Protesters|url=http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/politics/hundreds-of-canadians-rally-in-support-of-egyptian-protesters/article1887588/|work=[[The Globe and Mail]]|accessdate=31 January 2010|date=29 January 2010|location=Toronto}}</ref> On 29 January in [[Dearborn, Michigan]], 300 people expressed their solidarity for the Egyptian people.<ref>{{cite web|author=Steele, Micki|url=http://detnews.com/article/20110129/METRO/101290382/Protesters-rally-in-Dearborn-to-support-Egyptian-people |title=Protesters Rally in Dearborn To Support Egyptian People |work=[[The Detroit News]] |date=29 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Around 150 protesters demonstrated in solidarity with the Egyptian people in [[Nashville, Tennessee]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Choudhury, Atif|url=http://www.vanderbiltorbis.com/?p=164 |title=Nashville rallies in support of protests in Egypt, Tunisia |work=[[Vanderbilt Orbis]] |date=19 February 2011 |accessdate=19 February 2011}}</ref>
On 28 January [[Egyptian Canadian|Egyptians living in Canada]] and others gathered at the embassy in Ottawa as well as the consulate in [[MontrÃ©al]]. The next day, Canadians in [[Toronto]], [[MontrÃ©al]], [[Vancouver]], and other cities peacefully demonstrated in support of the uprising, criticising the Canadian government's cautious and generic response.<ref>{{cite news|author=[[Staff writer]]|title=Demonstrators Across Canada Rally in Support of Egyptian Protesters|url=http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/politics/hundreds-of-canadians-rally-in-support-of-egyptian-protesters/article1887588/|work=[[The Globe and Mail]]|accessdate=31 January 2010|date=29 January 2010|location=Toronto}}</ref> On 29 January in [[Dearborn, Michigan]], 300 people expressed their solidarity for the Egyptian people.<ref>{{cite web|author=Steele, Micki|url=http://detnews.com/article/20110129/METRO/101290382/Protesters-rally-in-Dearborn-to-support-Egyptian-people |title=Protesters Rally in Dearborn To Support Egyptian People |work=[[The Detroit News]] |date=29 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Around 150 protesters demonstrated in solidarity with the Egyptian people in [[Nashville, Tennessee]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Choudhury, Atif|url=http://www.vanderbiltorbis.com/?p=164 |title=Nashville rallies in support of protests in Egypt, Tunisia |work=[[Vanderbilt Orbis]] |date=19 February 2011 |accessdate=19 February 2011}}</ref>
Line 190: Line 190:
* {{flagcountry|Brazil}} The Brazilian embassy discouraged any trips to Egypt until the situation returns to normal and started evacuating Brazilians in the country.<ref name="MRE2">{{clarify|date=February 2011|reason=at minimum, needs english translation of portuguese headline appended next to portuguese headline}} [http://www.itamaraty.gov.br/sala-de-imprensa/notas-a-imprensa/situacao-no-egito SituaÃ§Ã£o no Egito] (in [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]]). Ministry of External Relations of Brazil. Retrieved 31 January 2011.</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Brazil}} The Brazilian embassy discouraged any trips to Egypt until the situation returns to normal and started evacuating Brazilians in the country.<ref name="MRE2">{{clarify|date=February 2011|reason=at minimum, needs english translation of portuguese headline appended next to portuguese headline}} [http://www.itamaraty.gov.br/sala-de-imprensa/notas-a-imprensa/situacao-no-egito SituaÃ§Ã£o no Egito] (in [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]]). Ministry of External Relations of Brazil. Retrieved 31 January 2011.</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Brunei}} The Brunei government had evacuated all of their 97 citizens out of Egypt via Dubai on a specially chartered flight.<ref>{{cite news| author= Siti Hajar and Azim Karim |url=http://brudirect.com/index.php/2011020238877/First-Stories/emotional-welcome-for-bruneians-from-egypt.html |title= Emotional Welcome for Bruneians from Egypt |work= Brudirect.com (Brunei Darussalam)|date= 3 February 2011 | accessdate= 4 February 2011}}</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Brunei}} The Brunei government had evacuated all of their 97 citizens out of Egypt via Dubai on a specially chartered flight.<ref>{{cite news| author= Siti Hajar and Azim Karim |url=http://brudirect.com/index.php/2011020238877/First-Stories/emotional-welcome-for-bruneians-from-egypt.html |title= Emotional Welcome for Bruneians from Egypt |work= Brudirect.com (Brunei Darussalam)|date= 3 February 2011 | accessdate= 4 February 2011}}</ref>
â
* {{flagcountry|Canada}} launched an evacuation plan to evacuate citizens from Egypt using [[Air Canada]] charter flights contracted by the [[Government of Canada]] to [[Frankfurt]], London, and Paris. Approximately 6,500 Canadian citizens in Egypt are expected to reimburse the cost of the plane tickets to Europe and self-arrange for an ongoing flight back to Canada.<ref>{{cite news |author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/story/2011/01/30/egypt-evacuation-protests.html|title=Canadians Could Begin Leaving Egypt Monday |work=[[CBC News]] |date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}{{dead link|date=April 2011}}</ref> Conflicting reports suggested that the government was willing to subsidise C$400 off ticket prices and organise flights out of the country. However, the government was unsure of how many citizens would take advantage of the offer. "The government is recommending that Canadians leave Egypt," Foreign Affairs Minister [[Lawrence Cannon]] announced. "... The situation is deteriorating, the situation is not under control."<ref>Martin, Patrick; Ibbitson, John (31 January 2011). [http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/crisis-in-egypt/first-stranded-canadians-ready-to-leave-cairo/article1888623/ "First Stranded Canadians Ready To Leave Cairo"]. ''[[The Globe and Mail]]''. Retrieved 31 January 2011.</ref>
+
* {{flagcountry|Canada}} launched an evacuation plan to evacuate citizens from Egypt using [[Air Canada]] charter flights contracted by the [[Government of Canada]] to [[Frankfurt]], London, and Paris. Approximately 6,500 Canadian citizens in Egypt are expected to reimburse the cost of the plane tickets to Europe and self-arrange for an ongoing flight back to Canada.<ref>{{cite news |author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/story/2011/01/30/egypt-evacuation-protests.html|title=Canadians Could Begin Leaving Egypt Monday |work=[[CBC News]] |date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Conflicting reports suggested that the government was willing to subsidise C$400 off ticket prices and organise flights out of the country. However, the government was unsure of how many citizens would take advantage of the offer. "The government is recommending that Canadians leave Egypt," Foreign Affairs Minister [[Lawrence Cannon]] announced. "... The situation is deteriorating, the situation is not under control."<ref>Martin, Patrick; Ibbitson, John (31 January 2011). [http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/crisis-in-egypt/first-stranded-canadians-ready-to-leave-cairo/article1888623/ "First Stranded Canadians Ready To Leave Cairo"]. ''[[The Globe and Mail]]''. Retrieved 31 January 2011.</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Cyprus}} was prepared to receive foreign citizens evacuated from Cairo.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.pseka.net/index.php?module=article&id=11657|title=As with Lebanon, once again Cyprus is the HUB for evacuees from a hot spot (Egypt).|publisher=PSEKA|date= 1 February 2011|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref> Cyprus It advised its citizens currently in Egypt to avoid areas where demonstrations were being staged.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.pseka.net/index.php?module=article&id=11656|title=Cypriots â Egypt â Advice.|publisher=PSEKA|date= 1 February 2011|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Cyprus}} was prepared to receive foreign citizens evacuated from Cairo.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.pseka.net/index.php?module=article&id=11657|title=As with Lebanon, once again Cyprus is the HUB for evacuees from a hot spot (Egypt).|publisher=PSEKA|date= 1 February 2011|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref> Cyprus It advised its citizens currently in Egypt to avoid areas where demonstrations were being staged.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.pseka.net/index.php?module=article&id=11656|title=Cypriots â Egypt â Advice.|publisher=PSEKA|date= 1 February 2011|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Finland}} organised a 200-seater [[Finnair]] [[Airbus]] to evacuate the approximately 150 Finnish citizens living in Egypt. According to Foreign Minister Alexander Stubb, the greatest challenge was to gather all Finns into one place to be evacuated. Finland allowed nationals of other countries to take vacant seats on the evacuation flights.<ref>{{Clarify|date=February 2011|reason=at minimum, needs english translation of finnish headline appended next to finnish headline}} {{cite web|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://www.iltalehti.fi/ulkomaat/2011013113103593_ul.shtml |title=Suomi harkitsee pysyvÃ¤sti EgyptissÃ¤ asuvien evakuointia|language=[[Finnish language|Finnish]]|publisher=''[[Suomen Tietotoimisto]]'' (via ''[[Iltalehti]]'')|date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Finland}} organised a 200-seater [[Finnair]] [[Airbus]] to evacuate the approximately 150 Finnish citizens living in Egypt. According to Foreign Minister Alexander Stubb, the greatest challenge was to gather all Finns into one place to be evacuated. Finland allowed nationals of other countries to take vacant seats on the evacuation flights.<ref>{{Clarify|date=February 2011|reason=at minimum, needs english translation of finnish headline appended next to finnish headline}} {{cite web|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://www.iltalehti.fi/ulkomaat/2011013113103593_ul.shtml |title=Suomi harkitsee pysyvÃ¤sti EgyptissÃ¤ asuvien evakuointia|language=[[Finnish language|Finnish]]|publisher=''[[Suomen Tietotoimisto]]'' (via ''[[Iltalehti]]'')|date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref>
* {{flagcountry|India}} sent a special commercial [[Air India]] flight on 30 January to bring back its citizens who wanted to return home. Some of the 3,600-odd Indians who live in Egypt had expressed an interest in returning.<ref>{{cite news |author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Special-AI-plane-to-bring-back-300-Indians-from-Egypt/articleshow/7391308.cms |title=Special AI Plane To Bring Back 300 Indians from Egypt |publisher=''[[Indo-Asian News Service]]'' (via ''[[The Times of India]]'') |date=30 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref>
* {{flagcountry|India}} sent a special commercial [[Air India]] flight on 30 January to bring back its citizens who wanted to return home. Some of the 3,600-odd Indians who live in Egypt had expressed an interest in returning.<ref>{{cite news |author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Special-AI-plane-to-bring-back-300-Indians-from-Egypt/articleshow/7391308.cms |title=Special AI Plane To Bring Back 300 Indians from Egypt |publisher=''[[Indo-Asian News Service]]'' (via ''[[The Times of India]]'') |date=30 January 2011 |accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Indonesia}} called for the quick evacuation of all Indonesian citizens in Egypt, most of whom were studying at [[Al-Azhar University]], by charter flights from [[Garuda Indonesia]].{{citation needed|date=February 2011}}
* {{flagcountry|Indonesia}} called for the quick evacuation of all Indonesian citizens in Egypt, most of whom were studying at [[Al-Azhar University]], by charter flights from [[Garuda Indonesia]].{{citation needed|date=February 2011}}
â
* {{flag|Ireland}} â The Department of Foreign Affairs said that as of 3 February it had "given assistance to approximately 400 Irish citizens [in Egypt]."<ref>[http://www.merrionstreet.ie/index.php/2011/02/statement-on-egypt-by-department-of-foreign-affairs/?cat=3 "Statement on Egypt by Department of Foreign Affairs"].</ref>
+
* {{flag|Ireland}} â The Department of Foreign Affairs said that as of 3 February it had "given assistance to approximately 400 Irish citizens [in Egypt]."<ref>[http://archive.merrionstreet.ie/index.php/2011/02/statement-on-egypt-by-department-of-foreign-affairs/ "Statement on Egypt by Department of Foreign Affairs"].</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Serbia}} evacuated tourists and people who worked in Egypt with two flights.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio5.co.rs/portal/moduli.php?naziv=Vesti&file=clanak&sid=80297 |title=Turisti Iz Srbije Danas Se VraÄaju Iz Egipta |publisher=RADIO 5 |date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=20 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vesti-online.com/Stampano-izdanje/02-02-2011/Dnevnik/114403/Srbija-evakuise--radnike-iz-Egipta |title=Vesti online / Å tampano izdanje / 2 February 2011 / Dnevnik / Srbija evakuiÅ¡e radnike iz Egipta |publisher=Vesti-online.com |date= |accessdate=13 February 2011}}</ref>
* {{flagcountry|Serbia}} evacuated tourists and people who worked in Egypt with two flights.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio5.co.rs/portal/moduli.php?naziv=Vesti&file=clanak&sid=80297 |title=Turisti Iz Srbije Danas Se VraÄaju Iz Egipta |publisher=RADIO 5 |date=31 January 2011 |accessdate=20 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vesti-online.com/Stampano-izdanje/02-02-2011/Dnevnik/114403/Srbija-evakuise--radnike-iz-Egipta |title=Vesti online / Å tampano izdanje / 2 February 2011 / Dnevnik / Srbija evakuiÅ¡e radnike iz Egipta |publisher=Vesti-online.com |date= |accessdate=13 February 2011}}</ref>
